artist: Silversmith: Richard Sibley II; Manufacturer: F.B. Thomas & Co.
description: teapot or kettle on stand, from a Wlm. IV and Victorian tea and coffee set; floral and scroll repousee chased ovate bodies
markings:
Marks

Coffee pot, teapot and sugar bowl (1857-58) fully marked on underside of bases and with the additional stamp [Thomas s/ Bond St.]. Interior of covers of coffee pot and teapot marked with makerâ€™s mark, lion passant, date letter.
Removable finial of coffee pot marked by Richard Sibley, lion passant, sovereign\'s head; wing nut securing finial marked with lion passant; handle marked with lion passant and sovereign\'s head.
Teapot fully marked on underside by Richard Sibley, 1858; underside of cover marked by Richard Sibley; lion passant, date letter; removable finial marked by Richard Sibley, sovereign\'s head, lion passant; handle marked by Richard Sibley, lion passant, sovereign\'s head.
Waste bowl marked on underside by [F.B. Thomas & Co.], 1890; stamped: [Thomas 152 new Bond Street].
Sugar bowl fully marked on underside by Richard Sibley, 1858; stamped on underside: [Thomas s / Bond St].
Milk jug fully marked on underside by F.B. Thomas & Co., 1876; stamped: [Thomas/153 New Bond Street].
Teakettle and stand fully marked on underside by F. B. Thomas & Co., 1890, and with additional stamp: [THOMAS / 153 BOND ST.] Interior lid of teakettle marked with lion passant and date letter.
Finial of lid is fully marked.
Wing nut for finial is marked with lion passant.
Stand is fully marked on outside of shoulder.
The pins securing the teakettle to the stand are marked with lion passant and leopard\'s head.
Spirit lamp is fully marked on underside and on inside of cover.
title: Teapot or kettle on stand
